Part of our problem is that the party out of power wants to impeach the president no matter who he is. I was against impreaching Bill Clinton. To even think of impeaching George Bush is absurd. 
 
 No, we are not better off than we were 6 years ago, but we are better off than we would be if Gore or Kerry were president. Bush has risen to the occasion. He has worked tirelessly to keep America safe since 9/11. 
 
 This is not Vietnam. All this has happened as a result of 9/11. Muslim fanatics aimed to destroy the heart and soul of America: our economic interests in the Twin Towers and our military strength at the Pentagon. The downed plane was to take out our Capitol and center of government. 
 
 Nor is this Vietnam in that no one is being drafted off the streets and forced into combat against his will. The men in Iraq are volunteers, professional soldiers. For my part, if any one of them can not handle the stress, bring him home. We do not need suicides. 
 
 Iran is the problem now. I perused the interview Ahmadinejad gave to Time Magazine. Ahmadinejad's world view hinges on his hatred for the United States and Israel. He denies the Nazi holocaust against the Jews in World War II and says that Israel should be "wiped off the map." He resents the U.S. being a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council when, in fact, the U.N. owes its existence to the United States. 
 
 Iran is developing nuclear plants. Nuclear energy is a wonderful thing when used for peaceful purposes. Every country which has developed nuclear energy also has the atomic bomb. Iran would be no exception. But it might be the one likely to use it or make it available to terrorist groups. We can not trust the fanatic fringe. If the hijackers had nuclear weapons on 9/11, there would be no New York City and no Washington, DC today. George Bush has looked them in the eye and warned them it will not happen on his watch. Let's support our president.

 The foreign detainees held at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and elsewhere do not have the same status as criminals....According to the Geneva Conventions, prisoners (even legitimate POWs) may be held for the duration of hostilities without trials. We did not try prisoners during World War II, for example. The notion would have been thought absurd. Some have observed that the detainees potentially face lifetime detention if hostilities continue, but this is because their leaders refuse to end their jihad against the United States.
 
 Furthermore, it is not as though all detainees are held for life. Approximately 315 of the 770 Guantanamo detainees have been determined by review boards not to be threats and have been released. Scores more are awaiting release to whatever countries that will accept them. There are few takers.
 
 It is not true that the detainees have been held without due process. The debate over the McCain amendment to the Detainee Treatment Act of 2005 was an attempt to define exactly what process was due. Congress chose not to include habeas corpus in this bundle of rights, leaving the question of detainee status to the Combatant Status Review Tribunals. The Constitution gives Congress the right to suspend the "privilege" of habeas corpus in the interest of public safety. (Yahoo.com)

The constitution does NOT give congress the right to suspend Habeus Corpus. 
 
 First, the constitution does not give the government ANY rights, it conveys powers to the government. Second, here is the relevant portion of the constitution:
 
 
The privilege of the writ of habeas corpus shall not be suspended, unless when in cases of rebellion or invasion the public safety may require it. 

 
 WHEN IN CASES OF REBELLION OR INVASION. While it is true that I have been busy lately, I THINK I WOULD HAVE NOTICED THE INVASION.

 First, I find it vaugly disturbign that you would want to pretend to be the mother of my children for long periods of time. Simone I could understand, since she was in love with me. I am starting to get a little concerned about the number of potential kidnappers/stalkers running around here. I know I am pretty irresistable (especially the receding hairline....chicks dig receding hairlines), but I am taken so you will all just have to cope :) 
 
 Second, if you have anythign of value, or electronic, and especially anything that covers both, you do NOT want my son running around, ESPECIALLY with a screwdriver. I have a lot of hobbies, most of which involve building things. My kids have always likes to sit and watch me work on stuff. When somethign is broken, my daughter brings it to me and says "daddy, can you fix this??" When my son breaks something, he brings it to me and wants me to give him some tools. My assistance is apparently not required...he will "fix" it himself. 
 
 So far THIS WEEK, he has taken the case off of my wifes computer and scragged the hard drive by unplugging it while running, destroyed one space heater, one keyboard (oured water in it), and taken the freakign ball out of my trackball and apparently made it vanish from the planet. 
 
 He has screwdrivers stashed all over the house in hiding places becuase he knows he is not supposed to have them. If it has screws, he feels compelled to remove them, disassemble the item, and see what is inside that e might like to have. 
 
 Also this week,we were showing my daughter how to ride bareback. Kids always freak out the first time they ride bareback. You put them up there and let them scream until you take about 10 steps and by then they have figured out it is OK. Put my daughter up there (she is 4...and YES...somebody was leading the horse). She started screaming, so my wifes mom started leading the horse off. From behind me I hear the 2 yr old scream NOOOOOO. I turn around just in time to see him come barreling around the side of the barn with a golf club and lay into that horse...jabbering the whole time. I dopn't know how much you know about horses, but they apparently HATE being beat with golf clubs. That horse started bucking and trying to kick the little guy. I jumped between the horse and the kid, gabbed him and tossed him. Got the XXXX kicked out of me. Got the daughter off the still bucking horse...got the XXXX kicked out of me some more. 
 
 
 The boy is still off to the side screaming at that horse and wagging his finger at it (my wife is a finger wagger). THe horse is terrorized. My daughter is terrorized. I have 4 broken ribs and am terrorized. The worst part was that I had no idea what to do about the kid. On the one hand, I felt like I should yell at him becuase hitting horses with golf clubs is a bad thing to do. On the other hand, I was kind of proud of him, because it takes a lot of courage for a kid who is 2 and a half feet tall to attack an 800 lb horse with a stick becuase he thinks his sister is being hurt. I ended up just telling my wife "you handle this" and going on up to the house. I'm still not sure what she did about it.
